Package ohos.accessibility.ability

Class AccessibilityWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.accessibility.ability.AccessibilityWindow

  • public class AccessibilityWindow
extends Object
    Provides information about one or multiple accessibility windows for you to obtain the content displayed on your device screen.
    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Accessibility#ABILITY

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int TYPE_ACCESSIBILITY_OVERLAY
      Indicates an accessibility overlay window.

      Indicates an application window.

      Indicates an input method window.
      static int TYPE_SPLIT_SCREEN_DIVIDER
      Indicates a split-screen window.
      static int TYPE_SYSTEM
      Indicates a system window.

      • get

        public static AccessibilityWindow get​()
        Obtains an AccessibilityWindow instance.
        Returns:
        Returns the cloned window.

      • get

        public static AccessibilityWindow get​(AccessibilityWindow srcWindow)
        Obtains an AccessibilityWindow instance cloned from the source window.
        Parameters:
        srcWindow - Indicates the source window.
        Returns:
        Returns the cloned window.

      • getWindowId

        public int getWindowId​()
        Obtains the window ID.
        Returns:
        Returns the window ID.

      • getWindowType

        public int getWindowType​()
        Obtains the window type.
        Returns:
        Returns the window type.
        See Also:
        TYPE_APPLICATION, TYPE_INPUT_METHOD, TYPE_SYSTEM, TYPE_ACCESSIBILITY_OVERLAY, TYPE_SPLIT_SCREEN_DIVIDER

      • getWindowLayer

        public int getWindowLayer​()
        Obtains the window layers that are hierarchically ordered. A window with a great layer is displayed on top of the one with a small layer.
        Returns:
        Returns the hierarchically ordered window layers.

      • getWindowTitle

        public CharSequence getWindowTitle​()
        Obtains the window title.
        Returns:
        Returns the window title.

      • getRectInScreen

        public Rect getRectInScreen​()
        Obtains the display area of this window on the screen.
        Returns:
        Returns the display area of this window.

      • isAccessibilityFocused

        public boolean isAccessibilityFocused​()
        Checks whether this window has gained accessibility focus.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this window has gained accessibility focus; returns false otherwise.

      • isFocused

        public boolean isFocused​()
        Checks whether this window has gained focus.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this window has gained focus; returns false otherwise.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive​()
        Checks whether this window is active.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this window is active; returns false otherwise.

      • getChildNum

        public int getChildNum​()
        Obtains the quantity of child windows.
        Returns:
        Returns the quantity of child windows.

      • getChild

        public Optional<AccessibilityWindow> getChild​(int index)
        Obtains information about the accessibility child window at a specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the index of the child window.
        Returns:
        Returns information about the child window.

      • getParent

        public Optional<AccessibilityWindow> getParent​()
        Obtains information about the parent window of this window.
        Returns:
        Returns the parent window.

      • getRootAccessibilityInfo

        public Optional<AccessibilityInfo> getRootAccessibilityInfo​()
        Obtains information about the root node in the window hierarchy. Then you can use the root node to traverse all subnodes in this window.
        Returns:
        Returns information about the accessibility root node.

      • getAnchor

        public Optional<AccessibilityInfo> getAnchor​()
        Obtains an anchor accessibility node that anchors this window to another window.
        Returns:
        Returns the anchor accessibility node.
